defs: the fact of (a person) living forever or a thing lasting relatively for a longer period.
a sīre that is of lesser width for young girls.
a strong feeling of displeasure and belligerence aroused by a wrong; anger; ire.
ಚಿರಡಿಗೇಳು caraḍigēḷu to become furious; to be infuriated.
a wedge shaped hand tool of steel with a sharp edge, for cutting or making holes in, metal objects; a chisel.
the work of cutting or making holes in, metal objects with a chisel.
the large, spotted carnivore, Panthera pardus, of the cat family, tawny with black markings; the panther; the leopard.
the quality or fact of being deathless, everlasting.
the nocturnal, carnivorous cat, Felis bengalensis (= Prionailurus bengalensis) resembling a leopard but smaller in size; the leopard-cat.
the quality or fact of being ever-fresh and new or having enthusiasm, liveliness for ever.
retaining the newness or being fresh forever or for long.
the quality or fact of retaining the newness or being fresh forever or for long.
(fig.) death; the end of one's life.
a permanent refuge, protection.
a closing of one's eyes for long.

a man (despite of his growing age) who remained young and lively for long.
known for long or well known.
a man who is thoroughly or well known (to another).

the quality or disposition of receiving and treating guests and strangers in a warm, friendly, generous way; an instance of this.
a festive celebration or occasion; festivity.
any eatable that is first offered to a deity and distributed, and which is considered as holy.

its berry.

a woman who remained forever in the auspicious state of having her husband alive.
